content.question: Which of the following correctly describes the relationship between the Mexican Supreme Court of Justice and other political institutions in Mexico?

choices.label: The president has the constitutional power to overrule decisions made by the National Supreme Court of Justice.
The president has the power to appoint or nominate members to the National Supreme Court of Justice.
Mexico’s constitution does not provide for an independent judiciary.
Mexico’s National Supreme Court of Justice has had its powers restricted by the legislative branch.

content.answer: The president has the power to appoint or nominate members to the National Supreme Court of Justice.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors of a course country.
